page.title: 03WASHINGTON OLD HALL
page.content: The Old Hall is famous because George Washingtons ancestors lived there.In 1936 it was due to be demolished but it was saved by the work of a local committee who restored it with help from English and American friends. In the garden are two stone eagles. In front is a sun dial.Nearby is a flagpole.The American flag is flown on three celebrations.Downstairs is the great hall.It is where the important people and guests used to eat.The table has a bench at each side.There is a fireplace at one end of the hall.The kitchen walls have probably survived from the 12th century when the manor house was originally built.The kitchen has a table like the servants used .The fireplace has a roasting jack and spits like those used to cook their meat.
